dt: {bc}the highest point, level, or part of something {bc}{sx|summit||}, {sx|crown||}
{bc}a garment worn on the upper body
{bc}the aboveground part of a plant having edible roots
{bc}the head or top of the head
used especially in the phrase {it}top to toe{/it}
{bc}the highest or uppermost region or part
{bc}a fitted, integral, or attached part or unit serving as an upper piece, lid, or covering
{bc}the highest position (as in rank or achievement)
{bc}a person or thing at the top
{bc}aces and kings in a hand or the three highest honors in a suit
{bc}the part that is nearest in space or time to the source or beginning
{bc}the first half of an inning in baseball
{bc}the highest degree or pitch conceivable or attained {bc}{sx|acme||}, {sx|pinnacle||}
{bc}the loudest or highest range of a sound
{bc}a platform surrounding the head of a lower mast that serves to spread the topmast rigging, strengthen the mast, and furnish a standing place for men aloft
{bc}such a part on a warship used as a fire-control station or antiaircraft gun platform
{bc}a forward spin given to a ball (as in golf or billiards) by striking it on or near the top or above the center
{bc}a fundamental quark that has an electric charge of + 2/3 and a measured energy of approximately 175 GeV

dros.drp: off the top of one's head

dt.t: sat down and wrote the … story {it}off the top of his head{/it}
acted like a man {it}on top of{/it} his job
tried to keep {it}on top of{/it} new developments
the deadline was {it}on top of{/it} them

dt: {bc}in a position of eminent success, happiness, or fame
{bc}beyond the bounds of what is expected, usual, normal, or appropriate

et: Middle English, from Old English; akin to Old High German {it}zopf{/it} tip, tuft of hair
shortdef: the highest point, level, or part of something : summit, crown
a garment worn on the upper body
the head of a plant; especially : the aboveground part of a plant having edible roots

dt: {bc}to cover with a top or on the top {bc}provide, form, or serve as a top for
{bc}to supply with a decorative or protective finish or final touch
{bc}to complete the basic structure of (something, such as a high-rise building) by putting on a cap or uppermost section
{bc}to bring to an end or climax

dt.t: the event was {it}topped{/it} off with a relay race

dt: {bc}to remove or cut the top of
{bc}to shorten or remove the top of (a plant) {bc}{sx|pinch||1b}
{bc}to rise to, reach, or be at the top of
{bc}to strike (a ball) above the center thereby imparting topspin
{bc}to make an end, finish, or conclusion

shortdef: to be or become higher than : overtop
to be superior to : excel, surpass

stems: off the top of one's head

dt: {bc}a commonly cylindrical or conoidal device that has a tapering point on which it is made to spin and that is used especially as a toy

shortdef: a commonly cylindrical or conoidal device that has a tapering point on which it is made to spin and that is used especially as a toy

dt: {bc}a pear-shaped top that is made to spin on the sharp metal peg in its base by the unwinding of a string wound round its center

shortdef: a pear-shaped top that is made to spin on the sharp metal peg in its base by the unwinding of a string wound round its center

dt: {bc}to make up to the full quantity, capacity, or amount

shortdef: to make up to the full quantity, capacity, or amount

dt: {bc}to end (something) usually in an exciting or impressive way

dt.t: We {it}topped off{/it} dinner with dessert and coffee.
The victory {it}tops off{/it} the coach's extremely successful career.
I added a little more coffee to {it}top off{/it} the mug.
He stopped at the gas station to {it}top off{/it} the car's tank.

shortdef: to end (something) usually in an exciting or impressive way
to fill (something) completely with a liquid

dt: {bc}to reach the highest amount or level and stop increasing

dt.t: Interest rates are expected to {it}top out at{/it} 15 percent.

shortdef: to reach the highest amount or level and stop increasing —often + at
